Cell.Data: An identification of the specification containing the total set of rules regarding semantic content, cardinalities and business rules to which the data contained in the instance document conforms.The identification may include the version of the specification as well as any customizations applied.
Identifies the business process context in which the transaction appears. It enables the buyer to process the document in an appropriate way.

BEAst: Order Response Number (T3345). Peppol: A unique identifier for an order agreement. The identifier must be globally unique since the receiver is using it as an order number (issued by the seller).
BEAst: Vendor Order Number (T6099). Peppol: An identifier of a referenced sales order, issued by the Seller.
BEAst: Document Date and Time (T6325). Peppol: The date on which an order agreement was issued. Must be formatted YYYY-MM-DD
BEAst: Document Date and Time (T6325). Peppol: The time of the day when the order agreement was issued. Format = "hh:mm:ss"
BEAst: Transportation Information (T6008). Peppol: Free-form text applying to the order agreement.Free text applying to the order agreement.
We have a new phone number 33 44 55
BEAst: Order Currency (T6018). Peppol: The default currency for the order agreement

BEAst: Project Number (T6004). Peppol: An identifier assigned by the Buyer used for internal routing purposes. The identifier is defined by the buyer (contact ID, department, office id, project code), but provided by the seller in the order agreement and later in the invoice.

A reference to a previous identifier for an order agreement. Used to indicatete that this agreement is a change to a previous agreement. This is an optional business term but is a required element in the UBL syntax so if no previous order identifier is available use NA.
BEAst: Ultimate Customer Order Number (T6221). Peppol: The identification of the call for tender or lot the order agreement relates to.

BEAst: Document Name (T6484), Offer Number (T6010), Freight Forwarder Reference Number (T6127) or Drawing Number (T6222). The DocumentType describes which of them. Peppol: An identifier for the referenced document.
BEAst: Document Type External (T6473), "BEAST:OfferNumber", "BEAST:FreightForwarderReferenceNumber" or "BEAST:DrawingNumber". Peppol: Textual description of the document.

BEAst: Embedded document binary object (T6475). filename contains Embedded document file name (T6476). Peppol: The attached document embeded as binary object, coded as Base64. The binary object has two supplementary components: a Mime Code, which specifies the Mime type of the attachment and a Filename that is provided by (or on behalf of) the sender of the document
The mime code of the attached document.
The file name of the attached document
BEAst: Link to Related Document (T6187). Peppol: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies where the external document is located.
BEAst: Reference to Agreement or Contract (T0007). Peppol: A reference that uniquely identifies a contract that relates to this transaction.
The supplier is the legal person or organization who provides a product or service.
Identifies the seller party's electronic address
Scheme identifier for the electronic address

BEAst: Supplier (T0009). schemeID tells what type of identity that is used. Peppol: A identifier for the seller that is issued by the party that sends the document in which the identifier is used.Identifies a party.
BEAst: Street Name (T5003). Peppol: The main address line in an address. Usually the street name and number or post office box.
BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.
BEAst: City Name (T5005). Peppol: The common name of a city where the address is located.
BEAst: Postal code (T6117). Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
The subdivision of a country such as region, county, state, province etc.
BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country Code (T5007). Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: Party Name (T5001). Peppol: The full (formal) name by which the seller is registered in the national registry of legal entities or persons.The name of the party.
Identifies a company as registered with the company registration scheme.
The identification scheme identifier of the buyer legal registration identifier.
BEAst: Name (T5012). Peppol: The name of the contact point.
BEAst: Phone Number (T5010). Peppol: A phone number for the contact point.
BEAst: Email Address (T5011). Peppol: An e-mail address for the contact point.
The customer is the legal person or organization who is in demand of a product or service.
Identifies the buyer party's electronic address
Scheme identifier for the electronic address

BEAst: Buyer (T0008). schemeID describes the type of identity that is used. Peppol: A identifier for the buyer that is issued by the party that sends the document in which the identifier is used.An identification for the buyer party.
BEAst: Street Name (T5003). Peppol: The main address line in an address.Usually the street name and number or post office box.
BEAst: Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.
BEAst: City Name (T5005). Peppol: The common name of a city where the address is located.
BEAst: Postal code (T6117). Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
The subdivision of a country such as region, county, state, province etc.
BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country code (T5007). Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
BEAst: Party Name (T5001). Peppol: The full name of the buyer.The name of the party who ordered the items and receives the response.
Identifies a company as registered with the company registration scheme.
The identification scheme identifier of the buyer legal registration identifier.
BEAst: Name (T5012). Peppol: The name of the contact point.
BEAst: Phone Number (T5010). Peppol: A phone number for the contact point.
BEAst: Email Address (T5011). Peppol: An e-mail address for the contact point.
The unit initiating the order. Most often the end user.
BEAst: Ultimate Customer (T6223). schemeID describes the type of identity that is used. Peppol: An identifier for the party that originally requested the ordered items.
BEAst: Party Name (T5001). Peppol: The name of the party that originally requested the ordered items.
The invoicee is the legal person or organization acting on behalf of the customer and who receives the invoice for the order.
BEAst: Invoicee (T0085). schemeID describes the type of identity that is used. Peppol: A unique identifier of the accounting customer
BEAst: Party Name (T5001). Peppol: Accounting customer name
Delivery gives information on when and where the goods and services are deleivered.
The period when the goods or services are delivered.
BEAst: Delivery Period Start Date (T6319). Peppol: The date when the period starts.The date is the first day of the period. Must be formatted YYYY-MM-DD
BEAst: Delivery Period Start Time (T6734). Peppol: The start time of the period. Format = "hh:mm:ss"
BEAst: Delivery Period End Date (T6320). Peppol: The date on which the period ends.The date is the last day of the period. Must be formatted YYYY-MM-DD
BEAst: Delivery Period End Time (T735). Peppol: The end time of the period.Format = "hh:mm:ss"
BEAst: Delivery Party (T0037). schemeID describes the type of identity that is used. Peppol: A identifier for the party that carries out the delivery.
BEAst: Party name (T5001). Peppol: The name of the party to which the goods and services are deliverd.
BEAst: Street name (T5003). Peppol: The main address line in an address. Usually the street name and number or post office box.
BEAst: Used for Department (T5002). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.
BEAst: City name (T5005). Peppol: The common name of a city where the address is located.
BEAst: Postal Code (T6117). Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
The subdivision of a country such as region, county, state, province etc.

BEAst: Used for any other additional address information like Building (T5004) or Delivery Place Location (T6015). Peppol: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country Code (T5007). Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
Information on delivery location and special delivery terms
BEAst: Terms of Delivery (T6710). Peppol: The terms that the buyer applies to the delivery the ordered items.
BEAst: Unloading Instruction Code (T6343). Peppol: A description of special conditions relating to the delivery terms.
BEAst: Delivery place Terms (T6020). Peppol: The location to which the delivery terms refer. Used to qualify the delivery terms e.g. "Terms of delivery are FOB Rotterdam"
BEAst: Consignee, Street name (T5003). Peppol: The main address line in an address.Usually the street name and number or post office box.
An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.
BEAst: Consignee, City name (T5005). Peppol: The common name of a city where the address is located.
BEAst: Postal Code (T6117). Peppol: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.
The subdivision of a country such as region, county, state, province etc.
An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

BEAst: Country Code (T5007). Peppol: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.
Information on allowance and/or charges applies to the whole order agreement and is included in the calculation of the order agreement total amount.
Document level allowance or charge reason code

BEAst: Special service description code (T6719). Peppol: The reason for the document level allowance or charge, expressed as a code. For allowances a subset of codelist UNCL5189 is to be used, and for charges codelist UNCL7161 applies. The Document level allowance reason code and the Document level allowance reason shall indicate the same allowance reason
BEAst: Special service description (T6111). Peppol: The reason for the allowance or charge, expressed as text.
Document level allowance or charge percentage

BEAst: Percentage (T6228). Peppol: The percentage that may be used, in conjunction with the document level allowance base amount, to calculate the document level allowance or charge amount. To state 20%, use value 20.
BEAst: Amount (T6230). currencyID is the same as DocumentCurrency (T6018). Peppol: The allowance or charge amount (net amount).
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
Document level allowance or charge base amount

BEAst: Base Amount (T6229). currencyID is the same as DocumentCurrency (T6018). Peppol: The base amount that may be used, in conjunction with the document level allowance or charge percentage, to calculate the document level allowance or charge amount. Must be rounded to maximum 2 decimals
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there
Document level allowance or charge TAX category code
A coded identification of what TAX category applies to the document level allowance or charge.
Document level allowance or charge TAX rate
The TAX rate, represented as percentage that applies to the document level allowance or charge.
The total TAX amount.The sum of all TAX category tax amounts.
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
A group of business terms providing information about TAX breakdown by different categories, rates and exemption reasons

Sum of all taxable amounts subject to a specific TAX category code and TAX category rate (if the TAX category rate is applicable). The sum of line net amounts minus allowances plus charges on document level which are subject to a specific TAX categorycode and TAX category rate (if the TAX category rate is applicable).
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
The total TAX amount for a given TAX category.Calculated by multiplying the TAX category taxable amount with the TAX category rate for the relevant TAX category.
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
Coded identification of a TAX category.
The TAX rate, represented as percentage that applies for the relevant TAX category.A TAX rate of 0% is applied for calculation purposes, even if the item is outside the scope of TAX.
A textual statement of the reason for why the base amount is exempted from TAX.
Sum of all line amounts in the document.
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
The total amount of the document without TAX including all line net amounts minus sum of allowance amount on document level plus sum of charges on document level.
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
The total amount of the document with TAX. The total amount with TAX is the Total amount without TAX plus the Total TAX amount. The Total amount shall be equal or greater than zero.
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
Sum of allowances on document level
Sum of all allowances on document levelAllowances on line level are included in the line amount which is summed up into the "sum of line net amount".
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
Sum of charges on document level
Sum of all charges on document level.Charges on line level are included in the line amount which is summed up into the "sum of line net amount".
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
The sum of amounts which have been paid a-priori.
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
Any rounding of the "Document total including TAX"
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.

The outstanding amount that is requested to be paid.This amount is the "document total amount with TAX" minus the "Paid amount" that has been paid a-priori. The amount will be zero in case the document total amount with TAX is fully paid .
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
BEAst: Line Number (T0051). Peppol: An identifier for an individual line that is unique within an order agreement.
BEAst: Line Item Information (T6031). Peppol: Free-form text applying to the order agreement line.
BEAst: Ordered Quantity (T0039). unitCode is Measure Unit NeB Type (T6706) Peppol: The number of item units that are ordered.
The unit of measure that applies to the ordered quantity.

BEAst: Line Item Net Amount (T6234). currencyID is the same as DocumentCurrency (T6018). Peppol: Order agreeement line amountThe total amount for the order agreement line, including all taxes except TAX.
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
Delivery information on order agreeement line level
BEAst: Quantity to be Delivered (T3240). unitCode is Measure Unit NeB Type (T6706). Peppol: The number of item units that are delivered.
The unit of measure that applies to the accepted quantity.
Promised delivery period for the order agreement line
BEAst: Delivery Period Start Date (T6319). Peppol: The date when the period starts. Must be formatted YYYY-MM-DD
BEAst: Delivery Period Start Time (T6734). Peppol: The start time of the period. Format = "hh:mm:ss"
BEAst: Delivery Period End Date (T6320). Peppol: The date on which the period ends.The date is the last day of the period. Must be formatted YYYY-MM-DD
BEAst: Delivery Period End Time (T6735). Peppol: The end time of the period. Format = "hh:mm:ss"

BEAst: Price Amount (T6235). currencyID is the same as DocumentCurrency (T6018). Peppol: The price of an item, exclusive of TAX, after subtracting item price discount."The net price has to be equal with the gross price less the item price discount.
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
BEAst: Price Unit Basis Quantity (T6722). unitCode is Measure Unit NeB Type (T6706), Peppol: The number of item units to which the price applies.
The unit of measure that applies to the base quantity.
BEAst: Price Code (T6025). Peppol: The type of the item price. The type may be given by using codes from UN/CEFACT code list 5387.
Information on discounts connected to the price
Only discounts are allowed for the price, hence the only valid value is false (meaning an allowance)
BEAst: Amount (T6230). currencyID is the same as DocumentCurrency (T6018). Peppol: Discount amount connected to the price
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
BEAst: Base Amount (T6229). currencyID is the same as DocumentCurrency (T6018). Peppol: The gross price of the item before subtracting discounts. E.g. list price.
Currency identifier, if element "Order agreement currency" (tir110-007) is used, this attribute must be the same code as used there.
BEAst: Product Information (T6037). Peppol: Free-form field that can be used to give a text description of the item. A detailed description of the item.
BEAst: Article Description (T6226). Peppol: A name for an item. A short name given to an item, such as a name from a Catalogue, as distinct from a description.
BEAst: Buyer's Part Article Number (T6022). Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the buyer, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the buyer's system.
BEAst: Supplier's Article Number (T0172). Peppol: An identifier, assigned by the seller, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the seller's system.

BEAst: Global Trade Item Number (T0154) or RSK Article Number Sweden (T6023). All other item number standards used within BEAst can not be used here until the organisation behind the standard decides to be a part of the codelist "ISO 6523 ICD". These are: NOBB Article Number (T6027), RT Article Number (T6460), TUN Article Number (T6028), Finfo/Vilma Article Number (T6029), Norwegian RSK Article Number (T6024), Norwegian E-number (T6026), E-number (T0260) and SGTIN (T6461). Peppol: An item identifier based on a registered scheme. Associates the item with its identification according to a standard system.
Item standard identifier identification scheme identifier
The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier
BEAst: Document Name (T6484). Peppol: Identifier of a document
A functional description of the attachment/image expressed as code
BEAst: Document Type External (T6473). Peppol: Textual description of the document.

BEAst: Embedded Document Binary Object (T6475). filename contains Embedded Document File Name (T6476). Peppol: The attached document embeded as binary object, coded as Base64. The binary object has two supplementary components: a Mime Code, which specifies the Mime type of the attachment and a Filename that is provided by (or on behalf of) the sender of the document
The mime code of the attached document.
The file name of the attached document
BEAst: Link to Related Document (T6187). Peppol: The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that identifies where the external document is located.

BEAst: Used to classify the material when the item number is not sufficient (T6466), to inform about the source of classification standard (T6467) and to provide standard branch codes for the items. The Reference to Article Class (T6466) is the ItemClassificationCode, listID = "ZZZ", listVersionID = BEAST:4.0" and name is Source to Classification (T6467). Peppol: A code for classifying the item by its type or nature. Classification codes are used to allow grouping of similar items for a various purposes e.g. public procurement (CPV), e-Commerce (UNSPSC) etc.
Item classification identifier identification scheme identifier
The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier
Item classification identifier version identification scheme identifier
The identification scheme version identifier of the Item classification identifier
Clear text name equivalent of classification code
The textual equivalent of the code value

BEAst: Price Type Code (T6720). In Peppol "CT" is the only valid code, so it can be used only when the Price Type Code is "CT". Peppol: The code CT indicates that the item is offered in accordance to the referenced contract.
BEAst: Tax Category NeB Type (T6708). Peppol: The TAX category code for the item.
BEAst: VAT Rate (T0027). Peppol: The TAX percentage rate that applies to the line amount.
BEAst: Tax Base Type NeB (T6707). Peppol: Tax scheme. E.g. “VAT” or “GST”
A group of business terms providing information about properties of the goods and services invoiced.

BEAst: Property Name (T6446). Peppol: The name of the property.The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant.
BEAst: Property ID (T6444). listID is Property ID Type (T6443). Peppol: Code for the item property according to a property code system.
An identifier for the code list used for the Name code, this is bilaterally agreed
BEAst: Property Value (T6452). Peppol: The value of the item property.

BEAst: Property Compare Code (T6457). unitCode is Measure Unit NeB Type (T6706). Peppol: The unit of measure in which the property value is stated, if relevant. May not be relevant when properties are descriptive.
The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity.
BEAst: Property Value ID (T6450). Peppol: Standardized and predefined classification of items properties.
Information about the items environmental, social, ethical and quality type of labelling.
BEAst: Certificate Number (T6413). Peppol: The name of the product label.
BEAst: The UBL structure used requires this element. Use the value NA. Peppol: The UBL structure used for item labeling requires this elements, use the value NA.
BEAst: Type of Certificate (T6412). Peppol: The label type such environmental, quality, social etc.
BEAst: Percentage Certified (T6414). Peppol: The label value that applies to the item.
BEAst: The UBL structure used requires this element. Use the value NA. Peppol: The UBL structure used for item labeling requires this elements, use the value NA.
A reference to where the label specification can be found, e.g. a URI.
